intro: Coronilla lassenii, commonly known as the Lassen's vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple, and it has trifoliate leaves composed of three oval-shaped leaflets. Coronilla lassenii is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it useful in ecological restoration projects. Its adaptability to harsh conditions makes it an important species in certain ecosystems.
